column1: Guanajay is a town and municipality in Artemisa Province in western Cuba
column2: located about 58 km (36 mi) southwest of Havana. The town lies among hills.

column1: In colonial times it was an acclimatization station for newly arrived troops from Spain
column2: and subsequently became well known as a health resort. Founded in 1650
column3: it was part of the province of Pinar del Río until 1976. It was then included in La Habana Province until that was divided in two in 2011.

column1: The country surrounding Guanajay is a fertile sugarcane and tobacco region
column2: and historically it has been an important distribution point in the commerce of the western end of the island. Guanajay was an ancient pueblo of considerable size and importance as early as the end of the 18th century.
the municipality of Guanajay had a population of 28
column3: 429. With a total area of 113 km2 (44 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 251.6/km2 (652/sq mi).
